recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Sesame Fish Curry is a spicy dish from Andhra Cuisine, where fish is cooked in sesame coconut ground paste.It is best enjoyed hot with white rice.
Fish are rich in protein and study has suggested that adding one portion of fish a week to your diet can cut your chances of suffering a heart attack by half.

Fish is thought to protect the heart because eating less saturated fat and more Omega-3 can help to lower the amount of cholesterol and triglycerides in the blood â€“ two fats that, in excess, increase the risk of heart disease.

preface: My friends mom made this dish once and the moment I had it, I knew i wanted the recipe. The one I had was indeed very spicy. I have adjusted the spice level as per my taste in this recipe.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Marinate fish with lemon juice, salt, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tbsp chilli powder. Keep it aside for minimum 2 hrs.
In a pan, roast sesame seeds until it turns light brown. Keep it aside.In the same pan, roast Cumin seeds and Fenugreek seeds together. Keep it along with sesame seeds.
In the same pan, add 1 tbsp oil. Once heated, add onions and fry till it turns to golden brown. Add coconut and switch off the stove. keep roasting the coconut till the color changes to brown.

First grind sesame, cumin and fenugreek seeds coarsely then grind together the onions and coconut mix along with coriander powder, tamarind juice and remaining chilly and turmeric powder. Add water to make it a fine paste.
In a wok\pan, add 1 tbsp oil, add the ground paste. Fry until water is evaporated and oil starts separating. You must keep frying otherwise, masala may get burnt.
I prefer frying the fish before adding to the curry for little crispiness. But you can add it directly
Add water slowly into it and mix it well. You can add more or less water as per your requirement.Add fish and salt. Cover the pan and let it simmer for 20 mins. Serve hot with rice.
